xxl.cursors
Class Sampler

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.AbstractCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.Sampler
public class Sampler
extends AbstractCursor

A Sampler is backed on a given Input-Iterator and represents a sample of the underlying Iterator by returning every n-th element.

Example usage: 

 	Iterator it = new Sampler(new Enumerator(1,100), 10);
 	while(it.hasNext())
 		System.out.println(it.next());
This simple example shows the creation of a Sampler that returns every 10-th integer of the given Enumerator with range [1,100[. So the generated output is as follows: 
 	10
 	20
 	30
 	40
 	50
 	60
 	70
 	80
 	90

See Also:
Iterator

Field Detail

n

protected int n
A parameter defining the interval between two elements. So every n-th element of the underlying Iterator will be returned by the Sampler.

iterator

protected Iterator iterator
The Iterator the Sampler is backed on.
Constructor Detail

Sampler

public Sampler(Iterator iterator,
               int n)
Creates a new Sampler backed on the given input-Iterator. This Sampler returns every n-th element of underlying Iterator.
Parameters:
iterator - the Iterator the Sampler is backed on.
n - a parameter defining the interval between two elements. So every n-th element of the underlying Iterator will be returned by the Sampler.
Method Detail

computeNext

protected void computeNext()
Computes the next element (Contract: this method computes the next element to be returned by a call to next(), it sets the next-field by calling setNext(Object). This next-field is set to every n-th element of the underlying input-Iterator. The other elements of the input-Iterator are simply traversed calling iterator.next().
Overrides:
computeNext in class AbstractCursor

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
